summary: The document is a comprehensive collection of personnel records, fitness reports, and correspondence detailing Mr. Myroslaw A. Maksymiec's employment history, reassignments, promotions, disability retirement, and commendations during his service with the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) and other governmental departments. It highlights his expertise in photography, challenges in adapting to new roles, and his significant contributions, including during the Cuban missile crisis. The document also includes detailed personal and professional information, suggesting it may be part of an official personnel file or application for employment or benefits.
key_findings: Mr. Maksymiec served in various capacities, including as a Photog (Gen) and D and E Tech, contributing to projects like the NPIC Technical Development Manual.
He was recognized for his contributions during the Cuban missile crisis with a Certificate of Commendation from the President.
Experienced challenges in adapting to new roles, leading to a fitness report indicating performance issues and emotional outbursts.
Approved for disability retirement in 1971 due to being found totally disabled for useful and efficient service in his position.
Post-retirement, he sought to review his personnel file and expressed interest in obtaining a special medallion for his contributions during the Cuban missile crisis.
Mr. Maksymiec is recognized as an expert photographer but is considered misassigned in his current role.
Recommendations are made to reassign him to a position where his photographic skills can be better utilized.
The report details his participation in external training programs and courses to improve his skills.
It mentions his efforts to overcome educational deficiencies, particularly in English, to advance his career.
His performance is rated in various categories, with strengths noted in his technical abilities and weaknesses in communication and theoretical areas.
The individual has a background in photography, with skills in both still and motion picture photography, and has received awards for their work.
There is evidence of military service, including assignments abroad and commendations for service during international crises.
References to the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) and the National Photographic Interpretation Center indicate a possible connection to intelligence work.
The individual has received recognition from high-ranking officials, including a Presidential commendation, for contributions to national security.
The applicant has detailed their proficiency in various language skills, including reading, writing, pronunciation, and speaking.
Security approval sections indicate the applicant has been approved for access to classified information up to Top Secret level, with conditions.
